title: Bookmarks show blue star but aren't in bookmark folders
content: I'm having an issue when saving bookmarks, I'll find a nice recipe, save it to my recipe folder, little blue star will show on the page showing its bookmarked but when I go to the folder, it's nowhere to be seen. I'm not sure what I'm doing wrong here, it use to work just fine before.

title: chs_intelligence.json files
content: The Firefox file "chs_intelligence.json" appears in the main hard drive of my Macbook Pro laptop, along with more of these files with names such as "chs_intelligence.json.15q0fp" etc. What is the function of these files, and can I delete them without disrupting the functioning of the browser? I am using Firefox version 115.1.0esr (64-bit), Mac OS x 10.14. Thank you.
creator: wilddonnn

title: Disable anti-aliasing but enable font hinting on Linux
content:
I've disabled anti-aliasing using the about:config option:

gfx.text.disable-aa: true

However, when I do this, the font letters becomes visually inconsistent. Some strokes are one pixel in width, others two pixels. The letter 'o' becomes squashed on the right hand side for example. I've attached a screenshot.

I presume this is because when aa is disabled, font hinting becomes disabled as well. I would like to be able disable aa and keep font hinting enabled.

I like to disable aa because I have below average eye sight and I prefer to display text fonts with hard edges because I find it easier to read.

I'm on Linux, so ClearType options aren't available.

I've tried all the other fonts, they all come out with the same issue (displayed in that font of course).
creator: infinitesimalau
